kpis.name: Problem Recognition
kpis.evidence_summary: All 12 interviewees immediately recognized and articulated the grocery shopping problem without prompting.
key_quotes: I've wasted 2 hours last week going to 3 different stores because none had fresh eggs - Interview #1
During rain season, I can't get vegetables delivered for days. My family eats dal for a week. - Interview #2
Krave Mart showed item in stock, I waited 2 hours, then they cancelled saying out of stock - Interview #3

kpis.name: Pain Frequency
kpis.evidence_summary: All interviewees experience grocery shopping challenges multiple times per week. 83% shop 3+ times per week.
key_quotes: We both work from home but still can't get groceries easily. The irony isn't lost on us. - Interview #10
I shop 3-4 times per week and it's frustrating every single time - Interview #2

kpis.name: Attempted Solutions (Workarounds)
kpis.evidence_summary: 10 of 12 interviewees have active workarounds. 7 different workaround types identified.
key_quotes: Currently uses WhatsApp groups to check with multiple stores. Sometimes calls stores before visiting - Interview #1
Orders from multiple apps simultaneously, cancels duplicates. Eats out when grocery shopping becomes too difficult - Interview #7

kpis.name: Dissatisfaction Level
kpis.evidence_summary: 92% (11/12) scored pain at 7+/10. Average of 7.8/10 indicates high-intensity problem.
key_quotes: Pain: 9/10 - I would pay Rs. 200 per delivery if I knew for certain the items would arrive within an hour - Interview #6
Pain: 9/10 - We both work from home but still can't get groceries easily - Interview #10
Pain: 8/10 - My restaurant depends on fresh vegetables. When my regular vendor runs out, I lose a day's business - Interview #9

kpis.name: Solution Fit
kpis.evidence_summary: 11 of 12 interviewees see clear fit with proposed solution. 75% scored purchase intent at 4-5/5.
key_quotes: Purchase Intent: 5/5 - I would pay Rs. 200 per delivery if I knew for certain the items would arrive within an hour - Interview #6
Purchase Intent: 5/5 - We both work from home but still can't get groceries easily. This would be perfect - Interview #10
Purchase Intent: 4/5 - Traffic from Clifton to Tariq Road takes 45 minutes. Real-time inventory would save me the trip - Interview #4

kpis.name: Must-Have Features
kpis.evidence_summary: 5 features mentioned by ≥50% of interviewees, indicating clear product requirements.
key_quotes: Live inventory would solve wasted trips to 3 different stores - Interview #1
Dynamic routing that avoids traffic jams would be amazing - Interview #4
I would pay Rs. 200 if I knew items would arrive within an hour - Interview #6

kpis.name: Switching Intent
kpis.evidence_summary: 9 of 12 willing to switch from current solutions. High dissatisfaction with Daraz/PandaMart.
key_quotes: Daraz Mart is slow. If your app delivers in 30-45 minutes with real inventory, I'd switch immediately - Interview #1
PandaMart cancelled on me twice last month. I'd try any alternative that's more reliable - Interview #3
I ordered from 3 apps last Friday. Only one delivered, 2 hours late. I'd consolidate to one good app - Interview #7

kpis.name: Budget Existence
kpis.evidence_summary: 9 of 12 have confirmed budget. Average monthly grocery spend is Rs. 18,000 (~$63 USD).
key_quotes: Rs. 2,500-3,000/week on groceries + Rs. 500/week on delivery fees. I'm already paying for delivery - Interview #1
I would pay Rs. 200 per delivery if I knew for certain the items would arrive within an hour - Interview #6
Rs. 4,500/week + Rs. 1,200/week on Careem for grocery runs. I'd pay for a better solution - Interview #10

kpis.name: Price Reaction (Acceptable Pricing)
kpis.evidence_summary: 9 of 12 find proposed pricing (Rs. 50-200/delivery) acceptable. Higher acceptance among working professionals.
key_quotes: Willing to pay Rs. 50-100 delivery premium for convenience - Interview #3
I would pay Rs. 200 per delivery if I knew for certain the items would arrive within an hour - Interview #6
Uses Careem for grocery runs at Rs. 300/trip. Rs. 100-150 delivery fee is cheaper - Interview #10

kpis.name: Purchase Process Clarity
kpis.evidence_summary: All 12 understand grocery delivery app purchase process. Category is well-established in Karachi.
key_quotes: Uses multiple apps (Daraz, PandaMart). I know the drill: download app, add items, pay with card or COD - Interview #3
I ordered from 3 apps last Friday. Process is straightforward - Interview #7

patterns.implication: Real-time inventory visibility is THE core value proposition
Traffic-aware routing is critical differentiator for Karachi
Market is primed for reliable alternative. Low competitive bar.
Partner with neighborhood kiryana stores vs. building dark stores

patterns.theme: Time is More Valuable Than Money
patterns.implication: Premium pricing for fast, reliable delivery is justified

next_steps: Finalize MVP scope: Focus on real-time inventory, traffic routing, 30-45 min delivery
Recruit 5-10 design partners from high-intent interviewees
Pilot kiryana partnerships: 3-5 stores in DHA, Gulshan, Clifton

launch_strategy.timeline: Weeks 1-2: MVP scoping, Weeks 3-8: Beta launch, Weeks 9-16: Public launch
